image.alt: normal knee joint pointing out the femur, patella, posterior cruciate ligament, anterior cruciate ligament, fibula and tibia

body.p: The ACL (anterior cruciate ligament) is a complex ligament system found in the knee that often needs repair in athletes. Which of the following functions do you think the ACL performs?

multiple_choice.choice: connects the knee to the quadriceps (thigh muscle)
softens the impact at the ends of the leg bones in the knee

response.feedback: Correct. The ligaments stabilize articulations. With ACL injuries, the knee is unstable and can even separate.
Incorrect. This is the job of a tendon. Tendons connect bones to muscles; ligaments connect bone to bone, and stabilize articulations.
Incorrect. This is the job of the cartilage. There are many examples of cartilage injury in the knee, but it is different than an ACL (ligament) tear.
Incorrect. The kneecap (or patella) is a bone.

part.hint: The ACL is a ligament; think about what ligaments do.
